intro: Geranium phaeum subsp. austriacum, commonly known as the Austrian geranium, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to central and eastern Europe. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems and trifoliate leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces clusters of small, pink to purple flowers from late spring to early autumn. It prefers well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight, often found in woodland edges and rocky habitats. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and conservation areas.
